body:
can you give more information about your installed apps, "visitor_localtime" is not something i see in owncloud/core or apps.
also see https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/contributing.md and https://raw.github.com/owncloud/core/master/issue_template.md

hm, as i could not access the system i am not able to give you the information. is there a way to reset the used applications to the default? or find out the installed applications?

does this help?

yes that helps, the apps i don't recognize are internal_messages and user_photo. you can disable these apps by setting 'enabled' to 'no'. this way you can find the app that is the problem.

i did as you advised. exactly the same result! then i set   'version' => '4.96.10', and got the following message
failed to upgrade "contacts". exception="failed to get existing database structure for updating (mdb2_schema error: schema validation error, default value of "visitor_localtime" is incorrect: "" is not of type "time")"
as it sayed "contacts" i set contacts to "no" and tried again.
failed to upgrade "files_versions". exception="failed to get existing database structure for updating (mdb2_schema error: schema validation error, default value of "visitor_localtime" is incorrect: "" is not of type "time")"

i did this for some other plugins and finally it worked!!!

> i did this for some other plugins and finally it worked!!!

@friedmar it would be good to know which, so we could inform the author to update the database structure.

i think this will not be possible. what i did with setting no to the plugins caused only in not updating the plug in. as contacts was involved i think we could definitely be sure that it is not the cause.

when i could login to oc and enabled contacts it was the old version before the upgrade. this makes also no sense. now oc is in an undefined state. i hope that with the finale version i could bring all updates up to date. otherwise i have to reinstall. there are not so much data in it. 

if you are using beta/rc things could happen!

> when i could login to oc and enabled contacts it was the old version before the upgrade. 

if this is the case something went wrong when you installed oc 5. can you tell exactly how you did?
@friedmar when you enable an app the update routine is run, so the database is be uptodate. how did you install the update? did you also update apps2 or where you installed owncloud/apps?

thomas,

this installation is on a system where i have no admin privileges. when i upgraded i had manually set up the version in config php. perhaps diring the changed setup in 5.0 somehow something went wrong.

as i said i try to upgrade again with the next version.

hell bart,

i tried the update to rc3 and most of the plugins off. this is what is in the log:

{"app":"php","message":"non-static method mdb2_schema::errormessage() should not be called statically, assuming $this from incompatible context at \/var\/www\/virtual\/wixhausen.de<http://wixhausen.de>\/aktive-senioren\/htdocs\/owncloud\/3rdparty\/mdb2\/schema.php#2794","level":2,"time":1362825290}
{"app":"php","message":"non-static method mdb2_schema::errormessage() should not be called statically, assuming $this from incompatible context at \/var\/www\/virtual\/wixhausen.de<http://wixhausen.de>\/aktive-senioren\/htdocs\/owncloud\/3rdparty\/mdb2\/schema.php#2794","level":2,"time":1362825290}
{"app":"core","message":"failed to get existing database structure for updating (mdb2_schema error: schema validation error, default value of \"visitor_localtime\" is incorrect: \"\" is not of type \"time\")","level":4,"time":1362825290}
 and of course the known message.

i backed up the database and the users.

when the official 5.0 verion is available i will do a clean installation an restore the database.

hi,
i just updated my install to owncloud 5.0 final and i have the following error very similar to the one described here:

> turned on maintenance mode
> failed to get existing database structure for updating (mdb2_schema error: schema validation error, default value of "birth_date" is incorrect: "" is not of type "date")

my log also shows messages like in the previous comment. has anyone solved this?
please keep us updated with the solution when one is found.
thanks!
